means: 坎伯兰郡（英格兰一郡名）

sentence.Network_en: In 1916, Georgia Tech beat Cumberland 222-0. No game since has been that lopsided.
sentence.Network_cn: 1916年，佐治亚理工以222比0的比分击败坎伯兰。之后再没有出现过比分如此悬殊的比赛。

sentence.Network_en: Charles had only 5,000 men, weary, hungry and badly armed, against Cumberland's 9,000 regular soldiers.
sentence.Network_cn: 查理只剩下疲惫不堪, 饥肠辘辘,装备低劣的五千个人了.而他们面对的是坎伯兰的九千名正规军队.

sentence.Network_en: The Tennessee River sculpts the east side of the Cumberland Plateau.
sentence.Network_cn: 田纳西河刻蚀着坎伯兰高原的东部边缘.

means.word_mean: 1. English general; son of George II; fought unsuccessfully in the battle of Fontenoy (1721-1765)
2. a river that rises in southeastern Kentucky and flows westward through northern Tennessee to become a tributary of the Ohio River in southwestern Kentucky
